owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

params.to: The address to send fees to

activeFlashloans(bytes32).notice: Mapping to track active flashloan operations

feeBps().notice: Fee percentage in basis points (1 basis point = 0.01%)

minProfitBps().notice: Minimum profit required for successful execution (in basis points)

documentation.text: @notice Fee percentage in basis points (1 basis point = 0.01%)
@notice Minimum profit required for successful execution (in basis points)
@notice Mapping to track active flashloan operations

@notice Set the fee percentage
 @param _feeBps New fee in basis points

@notice Set the minimum profit required
 @param _minProfitBps Minimum profit in basis points

@title FlashloanBase
 @notice Base contract for flashloan operations with upgradability, security, and custom workflow support
